modules.description: Checks if a substring of a given string consists entirely of '0' characters within a specified length. Operates on strings and integers to validate numeric patterns. Used to verify if a binary or numeric string segment is entirely zero-padded.

Provides functions for string manipulation, list transformations, and optional value handling. Works with strings, lists, and option types to simplify common data processing tasks. Used to clean and normalize input data before further processing in service workflows.

Checks if a substring of a given string contains only '0' characters within a specified range, validating numeric or binary patterns. It processes strings and integers to determine if a segment meets this condition. Functions include checking zero-padded sections, ensuring accurate numeric validation. For example, it can confirm that a binary string's first eight characters are all zeros or verify that a numeric string's middle portion is zero-padded.
